Jamaica - Second Program Loan : Loan 1715 -
            Project Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Jamaica - Second Program Loan :

docna.cdata!:
Jamaica - Second Program Loan : Loan 1715 -
            Loan Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Jamaica - Second Program Loan :
            Loan 1715 - Loan Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The purpose of the Second Program Loan
            Project is to support the Government's program to
            expand the value of exports of non-traditional manufactured
            goods by 25% a year over the next five years. Thirty million
            dollars of loan funds will be used to establish a revolving
            Export Development Fund, which will discount commercial bank
            loans made to exporters of manufactured goods. The Fund will
            provide foreign exchange for the importation by bona fide
            Jamaican exporters (and suppliers to exporters) of raw
            materials, intermediate goods and spare parts into Jamaica.
            The Fund will be replenished with US dollars from the sale
            of exports and is projected to turn over up to 1.3 times a
            year in the first year of operation and possibly more
            rapidly thereafter. The Fund will be a government-owned
            entity controlled and administered by JECIC, a Bank of
            Jamaica subsidiary. It will have a minimum existence of five
            years. $1.5 million of loan resources will be used to
            provide technical assistance to JECIC to develop its
            capacity to manage export financing programs and to JNEC to
            develop its capacity to provide export marketing assistance
            to manufacturers and to evaluate industrial development and
            export policies and incentives.
